verses.verse: Cast <S%H7971><s%> your bread <S%H3899><s%> on the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the waters, <S%H4325><s%> for you will find <S%H4672><s%> it after many <S%H7230><s%> days. <S%H3117><s%>

Divide <S%H5414><s%> your portion <S%H2506><s%> to seven, <S%H7651><s%> or even <S%H1571><s%> to eight, <S%H8083><s%> for you do not know <S%H3045><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> misfortune <S%H9567><s%> may occur <S%H1961><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> are full, <S%H4390><s%> they pour <S%H9553><s%> out rain <S%H1653><s%> upon the earth; <S%H776><s%> and whether <S%H518><s%> a tree <S%H6086><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> toward the south <S%H1864><s%> or toward the north, <S%H6828><s%> wherever <S%H4725><s%> the tree <S%H6086><s%> falls, <S%H5307><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> it lies. <S%H1961><s%>
He who watches <S%H8104><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%> will not sow <S%H2232><s%> and he who looks <S%H7200><s%> at the clouds <S%H5645><s%> will not reap. <S%H7114><s%>

Just <S%H9201><s%> as you do not know <S%H3045><s%> the path <S%H1870><s%> of the wind <S%H7307><s%> and how bones <S%H6106><s%> [are formed] in the womb <S%H990><s%> of the pregnant <S%H4392><s%> woman, <S%H4392><s%> so <S%H3602><s%> you do not know <S%H3045><s%> the activity <S%H4639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> who <S%H834><s%> makes <S%H6213><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> things. <S%H3605><s%>

Sow <S%H2232><s%> your seed <S%H2233><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> and do not be idle <S%H5117><s%> <S%H3027><s%> in the evening, <S%H6153><s%> for you do not know <S%H3045><s%> whether <S%H335><s%> morning <S%H2088><s%> or <S%H176><s%> evening sowing will succeed, <S%H3787><s%> or whether <S%H518><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> of them alike <S%H259><s%> will be good. <S%H2896><s%>
The light <S%H216><s%> is pleasant, <S%H4966><s%> and [it is] good <S%H2896><s%> for the eyes <S%H5869><s%> to see <S%H7200><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

Indeed, <S%H3588><s%> if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> should live <S%H2421><s%> many <S%H7235><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> let him rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in them all, <S%H3605><s%> and let him remember <S%H2142><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of darkness, <S%H2822><s%> for they shall be many. <S%H7235><s%> Everything <S%H3605><s%> that is to come <S%H935><s%> [will be] futility. <S%H1892><s%>

Rejoice, <S%H8055><s%> young <S%H970><s%> man, <S%H970><s%> during your childhood, <S%H3208><s%> and let your heart <S%H3820><s%> be pleasant <S%H3190><s%> during the days <S%H3117><s%> of young <S%H979><s%> manhood. <S%H979><s%> And follow <S%H1980><s%> the impulses <S%H1870><s%> of your heart <S%H3820><s%> and the desires <S%H4758><s%> of your eyes. <S%H5869><s%> Yet know <S%H3045><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> will bring <S%H935><s%> you to judgment <S%H4941><s%> for all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things. <S%H428><s%>

So, remove <S%H5493><s%> vexation <S%H3708><s%> from your heart <S%H3820><s%> and put <S%H5674><s%> away <S%H5674><s%> pain <S%H9567><s%> from your body, <S%H1320><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> childhood <S%H3208><s%> and the prime <S%H7839><s%> of life <S%H7839><s%> are fleeting. <S%H1892><s%>
